quotes.content: If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it; and this you have the power to revoke at any moment.
quotes.title: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.content: It is the power of the mind to be unconquerable.
quotes.title: Seneca

quotes.content: What really frightens and dismays us is not external events themselves, but the way in which we think about them. It is not things that disturb us, but our interpretation of their significance.
quotes.title: Epictetus

quotes.content: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.
quotes.title: Seneca

quotes.content: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
quotes.title: Seneca

quotes.content: As is a tale, so is life: not how long it is, but how good it is, is what matters.
quotes.title: Seneca

quotes.content: If a man knows not to which port he sails, no wind is favorable.
quotes.title: Seneca

quotes.content: Only time can heal what reason cannot.
quotes.title: Seneca

quotes.content: Timendi causa est nescire - Ignorance is the cause of fear.
quotes.title: Seneca
